sentence.text: Gentranscription by RNA polymerase IIlized epilepsies, particularly the idiopathic or genetic generalized epilepsies (GGEs), represent some of the most common epilepsies.

The first decade of the 21st century was marked by progress in understanding the basic biology of gentranscription by RNA polymtranscription by RNA polymerase IIse IIlized epilepsies including generalized/genetic epilepsies with febrile seizures plus (GEFS+) and GGE through studies of large families, discovering causative mutations in cardiac muscle cell action potential involved in contraction, positive regulation of sodium ion transport, inhibitory synapse assembly, and GABRA1.

positive regulation of sodium ion transport

sentence.text: Genes for epileptic encephalopathies such as protein-containing complex assembly were rediscovered in GGE, highlighting the biological continuum between different epilepsies.

Genome-wide studies examining common genetic risk factors identified common variants in cardiac muscle cell action potential involved in contraction, indicating a convergence of shared pathophysiological pathways in various types of epilepsies.
